last_used_time.caption: Last Used Time
last_used_time.description: The most recent usage time of an entity. See specific usage.

lat.caption: Latitude
lat.description: The geographical Latitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: 42.361145.

latency.caption: Latency
latency.description: The HTTP response latency measured in milliseconds.

launch_type.caption: Launch Type
launch_type.description: The specific type of Launch activity, normalized to the caption of the launch_type_id value. In the case of Other it is defined by the event source.

launch_type_id.caption: Launch Type ID
launch_type_id.description: The normalized identifier for the specific type of Launch activity.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The launch type is unknown or not specified.

1.caption: Spawn
1.description: Denotes that the Launch event represents atomic creation of a new process on Windows. This launch type ID may also be used to represent both steps of Unix process creation in a single Launch event.

2.caption: Fork
2.description: Denotes that the Launch event represents the "fork" step of Unix process creation, where a process creates a clone of itself in a parent-child relationship. WSL1 pico processes on Windows also use the 2-step Unix model.

3.caption: Exec
3.description: Denotes that the Launch event represents the "exec" step of Unix process creation, where a process replaces its executable image, command line, and environment. WSL1 pico processes on Windows also use the 2-step Unix model.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The launch type is not mapped. See the launch_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

ldap_cn.caption: LDAP Common Name
ldap_cn.description: The LDAP and X.500 commonName attribute, typically the full name of the person. For example, John Doe.

ldap_dn.caption: LDAP Distinguished Name
ldap_dn.description: The X.500 Distinguished Name (DN) is a structured string that uniquely identifies an entry, such as a user, in an X.500 directory service For example, cn=John Doe,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com.

ldap_person.caption: LDAP Person
ldap_person.description: The additional LDAP attributes that describe a person.

lease_dur.caption: Lease Duration
lease_dur.description: This represents the length of the DHCP lease in seconds. This is present in DHCP Ack events.

leave_time.caption: Leave Time
leave_time.description: The timestamp when the user left or will be leaving the organization.

length.caption: Response Length
length.description: The HTTP response length, in number of bytes.

license.caption: Software License
license.description: The name or identifier of the license applied on package or software. See SPDX License List.

license_url.caption: Software License URL
license_url.description: The URL pointing to the license applied on package or software. This is typically a LICENSE.md file within a repository.

lineage.caption: Lineage
lineage.description: The lineage of the process, represented by a list of paths for each ancestor process. For example: ['/usr/sbin/sshd', '/usr/bin/bash', '/usr/bin/whoami'].

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.description: The Load Balancer object contains information related to the device that is distributing incoming traffic to specified destinations.

load_type.caption: Load Type
load_type.description: The load type, normalized to the caption of the load_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

load_type_id.caption: Load Type ID
load_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the load type. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The load type is not mapped. See the load_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

loaded_modules.caption: Loaded Modules
loaded_modules.description: The list of loaded module names.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.

locations.caption: Geo Locations
locations.description: A list of detailed geographical locations.

log_format.caption: Log Format
log_format.description: The format of data in the log. See specific usage.

log_level.caption: Log Level
log_level.description: The log specific level at which an event was generated. See specific usage.

log_name.caption: Log Name
log_name.description: The log name. See specific usage.

log_provider.caption: Log Provider
log_provider.description: The logging provider or logging service that logged the event. See specific usage.

log_source.caption: Log Source
log_source.description: The log where the data originated. See specific usage.

log_type.caption: Log Type
log_type.description: The log type, normalized to the caption of the log_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

1.caption: OS
1.description: The log type is an Operating System log.

2.caption: Application
2.description: The log type is an Application log.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The log type is not mapped. See the log_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

log_version.caption: Log Version
log_version.description: The log version. See specific usage.

logged_time.caption: Logged Time
logged_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

loggers.caption: Loggers
loggers.description: An array of Logger objects that describe the pipeline of devices and logging products between the event source and its eventual destination. Note, this attribute can be used when there is a complex end-to-end path of event flow and/or to track the chain of custody of the data.

login_endpoint.caption: Login Endpoint
login_endpoint.description: URL for initiating a login request. See specific usage.

logon_process.caption: Logon Process
logon_process.description: The trusted process that validated the authentication credentials.

logon_type.caption: Logon Type
logon_type.description: The logon type, normalized to the caption of the logon_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

1.caption: System
1.description: Used only by the System account, for example at system startup.

2.caption: Interactive
2.description: A local logon to device console.

3.caption: Network
3.description: A user or device logged onto this device from the network.

4.caption: Batch
4.description: A batch server logon, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention.

5.caption: OS Service
5.description: A logon by a service or daemon that was started by the OS.

8.caption: Network Cleartext
8.description: A user logged on to this device from the network. The user's password in the authentication package was not hashed.

9.caption: New Credentials
9.description: A caller cloned its current token and specified new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identity, but uses different credentials for other network connections.

10.caption: Remote Interactive
10.description: A remote logon using Terminal Services or remote desktop application.

11.caption: Cached Interactive
11.description: A user logged on to this device with network credentials that were stored locally on the device and the domain controller was not contacted to verify the credentials.

12.caption: Cached Remote Interactive
12.description: Same as Remote Interactive. This is used for internal auditing.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The logon type is not mapped. See the logon_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

logout_endpoint.caption: Logout Endpoint
logout_endpoint.description: URL for initiating a logout request. See specific usage.

long.caption: Longitude
long.description: The geographical Longitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: -71.057083.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address that is associated with the network interface.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

malware_scan_info.caption: Malware Scan Info
malware_scan_info.description: Describes details about the scan job that identified malware on the target system.

manager.caption: Manager
manager.description: The user's manager. This helps in understanding an org hierarchy. This should only ever be populated once in an event. I.e. there should not be a manager's manager in an event.

match_details.caption: Match Details
match_details.description: The data in a request that rule matched. For example: '["10","and","1"]'.

match_location.caption: Match Location
match_location.description: The location of the matched data in the source which resulted in the triggered firewall rule. For example: HEADER.

meets_criteria.caption: Meets Criteria
meets_criteria.description: Determines if an assessment, control, policy, or otherwise meets its assessment criteria. See specific usage.

meid.caption: MEID
meid.description: The Mobile Equipment Identifier. It's a unique number that identifies a Code Division Multiple Access (CDMA) mobile device.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

message_trace_uid.caption: Message Trace UID
message_trace_uid.description: The identifier that tracks a message that travels through multiple points of a messaging service.

references.description: For example Office 365 Message Trace Report.

message_uid.caption: Message UID
message_uid.description: The email header Message-ID value, as defined by RFC 5322.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

metadata_endpoint.caption: Metadata Endpoint
metadata_endpoint.description: URL where metadata about a configuration or resource is available (e.g., for SAML configurations). See specific usage.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: The general purpose metrics associated with the event. See specific usage.

mime_type.caption: MIME type
mime_type.description: The Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type of the file, if applicable.

mitigation.caption: MITRE Mitigation
mitigation.description: The Mitigation object describes the MITRE ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Mitigation ID and/or name that is associated to an attack.

model.caption: Model
model.description: The model name of an entity. See specific usage.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the object was last modified. See specific usage.

modifier.caption: Modifier
modifier.description: The user that last modified the object associated with the event. See specific usage.

module.caption: Module
module.description: The module that pertains to the event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the entity. See specific usage.

name_servers.caption: Name Servers
name_servers.description: A collection of name servers related to a domain registration or other record.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful in merger or acquisition situations. For example, when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

network_driver.caption: Network Driver
network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container. For example, bridge, overlay, host, none, etc.

network_endpoint.caption: Network Endpoint
network_endpoint.description: The Network Endpoint object describes characteristics of a network endpoint. See specific usage.

network_interfaces.caption: Network Interfaces
network_interfaces.description:
The physical or virtual network interfaces that are associated with the device, one for each unique MAC address/IP address/hostname/name combination.

Note: The first element of the array is the network information that pertains to the event.

network_scope.caption: Network Scope
network_scope.description: Indicates whether the endpoint resides inside the customer’s network, outside on the Internet, or if its location relative to the customer’s network cannot be determined. The value is normalized to the caption of the network_scope_id.

network_scope_id.caption: Network Scope ID
network_scope_id.description: The normalized identifier of the endpoint’s network scope. The normalized network scope identifier indicates whether the endpoint resides inside the customer’s network, outside on the Internet, or if its location relative to the customer’s network cannot be determined.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: Unknown whether this endpoint resides within the customer’s network.

1.caption: Internal
1.description: The endpoint resides inside the customer’s network.

2.caption: External
2.description: The endpoint is on the Internet or otherwise external to the customer’s network.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The network scope is not mapped. See the network_scope attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

next_run_time.caption: Next Run
next_run_time.description: The next run time. See specific usage.

nist.caption: NIST List
nist.description: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework recommendations for managing the cybersecurity risk.

nodes.caption: Nodes
nodes.description: The list of node objects that are part of the graph.

num_infected.caption: Number of Infected Entities
num_infected.description: The number of infected entities. See specific usage.

num_network_items.caption: Scanned Network Items
num_network_items.description: The number of network items scanned.

num_registry_items.caption: Scanned Registry Items
num_registry_items.description: The number of registry items scanned.

num_resolutions.caption: Resolutions
num_resolutions.description: The number of items that were resolved.

num_violations.caption: Violations
num_violations.description: The number of times the policy or rule was violated.

num_volumes.caption: Number of Volumes
num_volumes.description: The number of volumes in the storage device. See specific usage.

number.caption: Number
number.description: The number of the entity. See specific usage.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

observation_parameter.caption: Observation Parameter
observation_parameter.description: The name of the parameter being analyzed or monitored. This generally identifies the specific characteristic or property being measured. See specific usage.

observation_point.caption: Observation Point
observation_point.description: The normalized observation point value. See specific usage.

observation_point_id.caption: Observation Point ID
observation_point_id.description: The normalized identifier of the observation point. See specific usage.

observation_type.caption: Observation Type
observation_type.description: The classification or category of the observation, indicating what kind of measurement or finding it represents. See specific usage.

observations.caption: Observations
observations.description: A list of individual observations or measurements collected during analysis. Each observation captures a specific data point. See specific usage.

observed_pattern.caption: Observed Pattern
observed_pattern.description: A detected pattern or trend identified in the analyzed data, describing recurring activities or characteristics.

occurrence_details.caption: Occurrence Details
occurrence_details.description: Details about where in the target entity the specified information was discovered. See specific usage.

occurrences.caption: Occurrences
occurrences.description: A list of occurrence_details objects, each describing where in the target entity the specified information was discovered. See specific usage.

office_location.caption: Office Location
office_location.description: The primary office location associated with the user. This could be any string and isn't a specific address. For example, South East Virtual.

opcode.caption: DNS Opcode
opcode.description: The DNS opcode specifies the type of the query message.

opcode_id.caption: DNS Opcode ID
opcode_id.description: The DNS opcode ID specifies the normalized query message type as defined in RFC-5395.

1.caption: Inverse Query
1.description: Inverse query, obsolete

2.caption: Status
2.description: Server status request

3.caption: Reserved
3.description: Reserved, not used

99.caption: Other
99.description: The DNS Opcode is not defined by the RFC. See the opcode attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

open_mask.caption: Open Mask
open_mask.description: The Windows options needed to open a registry key.

open_ports.caption: Open Ports
open_ports.description: The list of open ports on a network interface, including port numbers and associated protocol information.

opnum.caption: Opnum
opnum.description: An operation number used to identify a specific remote procedure call (RPC) method or a method in an interface.

orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, or OpenShift.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit relevant to the event or object. See specific usage.

original_event_uid.caption: Original Event ID
original_event_uid.description: The unique identifier assigned to the event in its original logging system before transformation to OCSF format. This field preserves the source system's native event identifier, enabling traceability back to the raw log entry. For example, a Windows Event Record ID, a syslog message ID, a Splunk _cd value, or a database transaction log sequence number.

original_time.caption: Original Time
original_time.description: The original event time as reported by the event source. For example, the time in the original format from system event log such as Syslog on Unix/Linux and the System event file on Windows. Omit if event is generated instead of collected via logs.

os_machine_uuid.caption: OS Machine UUID
os_machine_uuid.description: The operating system assigned Machine ID. In Windows, this is the value stored at the registry path: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Cryptography\MachineGuid. In Linux, this is stored in the file: /etc/machine-id.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

ou_name.caption: Org Unit Name
ou_name.description: The name of the organizational unit, within an organization.  For example, Finance, IT, R&D

ou_uid.caption: Org Unit ID
ou_uid.description: The alternate identifier for an entity's unique identifier. For example, its Active Directory OU DN or AWS OU ID.

overall_score.caption: Overall Score
overall_score.description: The overall score as reported by the event source. See specific usage.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The user that owns the file/object.

package.caption: Software Package
package.description: The Software Package object describes details about a software package.

package_manager.caption: Package Manager
package_manager.description: The software packager manager utilized to manage a package on a system, e.g. npm, yum, dpkg etc.

package_manager_url.caption: Package Manager URL
package_manager_url.description: The URL of the package or library at the package manager, or the specific URL or URI of an internal package manager link such as AWS CodeArtifact or Artifactory.

packages.caption: Software Packages
packages.description: List of vulnerable packages as identified by the security product

packet_uid.caption: Packet UID
packet_uid.description: The packet identifier assigned by the protocol.

packets.caption: Total Packets
packets.description: The total number of packets (in and out).

packets_in.caption: Packets In
packets_in.description: The number of packets sent from the destination to the source.

packets_out.caption: Packets Out
packets_out.description: The number of packets sent from the source to the destination.

page_number.caption: Page Number
page_number.description: The page number of the document. See specific usage.

parameters.caption: Parameters
parameters.description: The parameters passed into a function invocation.

parent_folder.caption: Parent Folder
parent_folder.description: The parent folder in which the file resides. For example: c:\windows\system32

parent_process.caption: Parent Process
parent_process.description: The parent process of this process object. It is recommended to only populate this field for the top-level process object, to prevent deep nesting. Additional ancestry information can be supplied in the ancestry attribute.

parent_uid.caption: Parent Unique ID
parent_uid.description: The unique identifier of an object's parent object. See specific usage.

password_last_used_time.caption: Password Last Used Time
password_last_used_time.description: The time when a user's password was last used. See specific usage.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The path that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

pattern_match.caption: Pattern Match
pattern_match.description: A text, binary, file name, or datastore that matched against a detection rule.

percentile.caption: EPSS Percentile
percentile.description: The EPSS score's percentile representing relative importance and ranking of the score in the larger EPSS dataset.

peripheral_device.caption: Peripheral Device
peripheral_device.description: The peripheral device that triggered the event.

permission.caption: Permission
permission.description: The IAM permission related to an event

permission_analysis_results.caption: Permission Analysis Results
permission_analysis_results.description: Describes analysis results of permissions, policies directly associated with an identity (user, role, or service account). This evaluates what permissions an identity has been granted through attached policies, which privileges are actively used versus unused, and identifies potential over-privileged access. Use this for identity-centric security assessments such as privilege audits, dormant permission discovery, and least-privilege compliance analysis.

phase_id.caption: Kill Chain Phase ID
phase_id.description: The cyber kill chain phase identifier.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The kill chain phase is unknown.

1.caption: Reconnaissance
1.description: The attackers pick a target and perform a detailed analysis, start collecting information (email addresses, conferences information, etc.) and evaluate the victim’s vulnerabilities to determine how to exploit them.

2.caption: Weaponization
2.description: The attackers develop a malware weapon and aim to exploit the discovered vulnerabilities.

3.caption: Delivery
3.description: The intruders will use various tactics, such as phishing, infected USB drives, etc.

4.caption: Exploitation
4.description: The intruders start leveraging vulnerabilities to executed code on the victim’s system.

5.caption: Installation
5.description: The intruders install malware on the victim’s system.

6.caption: Command & Control
6.description: Malware opens a command channel to enable the intruders to remotely manipulate the victim's system.

7.caption: Actions on Objectives
7.description: With hands-on keyboard access, intruders accomplish the mission’s goal.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The kill chain phase is not mapped. See the phase attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

phone_number.caption: Phone Number
phone_number.description: The number associated with the phone.

phones.caption: Phones
phones.description: The phone numbers associated with the user

physical_height.caption: Physical Height
physical_height.description: The numeric physical height of display.

physical_orientation.caption: Physical Orientation
physical_orientation.description: The numeric physical orientation of display.

physical_width.caption: Physical Width
physical_width.description: The numeric physical width of display.

pid.caption: Process ID
pid.description: The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

pod_uuid.caption: Pod UUID
pod_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the pod (or equivalent) that the container is executing on.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Describes details of a policy. See specific usage.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The TCP/UDP port number associated with a connection. See specific usage.

post_value.caption: Post-Value
post_value.description: The value after. See specific usage.

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

pre_value.caption: Pre-Value
pre_value.description: The value before. See specific usage.

precision.caption: Precision
precision.description: The numeric precision. See specific usage.

pressure_altitude.caption: Pressure Altitude
pressure_altitude.description: The uncorrected barometric pressure altitude (based on reference standard 29.92 inHg, 1013.25 mb) provides a reference for algorithms that utilize 'altitude deltas' between aircraft. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m.. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

prev_security_level.caption: Previous Security Level
prev_security_level.description: The previous security level of the entity

prev_security_level_id.caption: Previous Security Level ID
prev_security_level_id.description: The previous security level of the entity

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security level is not mapped. See the prev_security_level attribute, which contains data source specific values.

prev_security_states.caption: Previous Security States
prev_security_states.description: The previous security states. See specific usage.

priority.caption: Priority
priority.description: The priority, normalized to the caption of the priority_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

priority_id.caption: Priority ID
priority_id.description: The normalized priority. Priority identifies the relative importance of the incident or finding. It is a measurement of urgency.

1.caption: Low
1.description: Application or personal procedure is unusable, where a workaround is available or a repair is possible.

2.caption: Medium
2.description: Non-critical function or procedure is unusable or hard to use causing operational disruptions with no direct impact on a service's availability. A workaround is available.

3.caption: High
3.description: Critical functionality or network access is interrupted, degraded or unusable, having a severe impact on services availability. No acceptable alternative is possible.

4.caption: Critical
4.description: Interruption making a critical functionality inaccessible or a complete network interruption causing a severe impact on services availability. There is no possible alternative.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The priority is not normalized.

processed_time.caption: Processed Time
processed_time.description: The event processed time, such as an ETL operation.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product that reported the event.

@deprecated.message: Use the uid attribute in the product object instead. See specific usage.

profiles.caption: Profiles
profiles.description: The list of profiles used to create the event. Profiles should be referenced by their name attribute for core profiles, or extension/name for profiles from extensions.

programmatic_credentials.caption: Programmatic Credentials
programmatic_credentials.description: Details about the programmatic credential (API key, service account key, access token, certificate). See specific usage.

project_uid.caption: Project ID
project_uid.description: The unique identifier of a Cloud project.

protocol_name.caption: Protocol Name
protocol_name.description: The protocol name. See specific usage.

protocol_num.caption: Protocol Number
protocol_num.description: The IP protocol number, as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). For example: 6 for TCP and 17 for UDP.

protocol_ver.caption: Protocol Version
protocol_ver.description: The Protocol version, normalized to the caption of the protocol_ver_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

protocol_ver_id.caption: Protocol Version ID
protocol_ver_id.description: The normalized identifier of the Protocol version. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The protocol version is not mapped. See the protocol_ver attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The origin of information associated with the event. See specific usage.

proxy.caption: Proxy
proxy.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_connection_info.caption: Proxy Connection Info
proxy_connection_info.description: The connection information from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_http_request.caption: Proxy HTTP Request
proxy_http_request.description: The HTTP Request from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_http_response.caption: Proxy HTTP Response
proxy_http_response.description: The HTTP Response from the remote server to the proxy server.

proxy_tls.caption: Proxy TLS
proxy_tls.description: The TLS protocol negotiated between the proxy server and the remote server.

proxy_traffic.caption: Proxy Traffic
proxy_traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network, from proxy to remote server at a given point of time.

ptid.caption: Process Thread ID
ptid.description: The identifier of the process thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

query_evidence.caption: Query Evidence
query_evidence.description: The resulting evidence discovered from the evidence search request.

query_info.caption: Query Info
query_info.description: The query info object holds information related to data access within a datastore. To access, manipulate, delete, or retrieve data from a datastore, a database query must be written using a specific syntax.

query_language.caption: Query Language
query_language.description: The query language, normalized to the caption of the query_language_id value. See specific usage.

query_language_id.caption: Query Language ID
query_language_id.description: The normalized identifier of the query language. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The Query Language is not mapped. See the query_language attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

query_result_id.caption: Query Result ID
query_result_id.description: The normalized identifier of the query result.

1.caption: Exists
1.description: The target was found.

2.caption: Partial
2.description: The target was partially found.

3.caption: Does not exist
3.description: The target was not found.

5.caption: Unsupported
5.description: Discovery of the target was not supported.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The query result is not mapped. See the query_result attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

query_string.caption: HTTP Query String
query_string.description: The query portion of the URL. For example: the query portion of the URL http://www.example.com/search?q=bad&sort=date is q=bad&sort=date.

query_time.caption: Query Time
query_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) query time.

query_type.caption: Query Type
query_type.description: The normalized caption of query_type_id or the source-specific query type.

query_type_id.caption: Query Type ID
query_type_id.description: The normalized type of system query performed against a device or system component.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The query type was unknown or not specified.

1.caption: Kernel
1.description: A query about kernel resources including system calls, shared mutex, or other kernel components.

2.caption: File
2.description: A query about file attributes, metadata, content, hash values, or properties.

3.caption: Folder
3.description: A query about folder attributes, metadata, content, or structure.

4.caption: Admin Group
4.description: A query about group membership, privileges, domain, or group properties.

5.caption: Job
5.description: A query about scheduled jobs, their command lines, run states, or execution times.

6.caption: Module
6.description: A query about loaded modules, their base addresses, load types, or function entry points.

7.caption: Network Connection
7.description: A query about active network connections, boundaries, protocols, or TCP states.

8.caption: Network Interfaces
8.description: A query about physical or virtual network interfaces, their IP/MAC addresses, or types.

9.caption: Peripheral Device
9.description: A query about attached peripheral devices, their classes, models, or vendor information.

10.caption: Process
10.description: A query about running processes, command lines, ancestry, loaded modules, or execution context.

11.caption: Service
11.description: A query about system services, their names, versions, labels, or properties.

12.caption: Session
12.description: A query about authenticated user or service sessions, their creation times, or issuer details.

13.caption: User
13.description: A query about user accounts, their properties, credentials, or domain information.

14.caption: Users
14.description: A query about multiple users belonging to an administrative group.

15.caption: Startup Item
15.description: A query about startup configuration items, their run modes, start types, or current states.

16.caption: Registry Key
16.description: A Windows-specific query about registry keys, their paths, security descriptors, or modification times.

17.caption: Registry Value
17.description: A Windows-specific query about registry values, their data types, content, or names.

18.caption: Prefetch
18.description: A Windows-specific query about prefetch files, their run counts, last execution times, or existence.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The query type was not mapped to a standard category. See the query_type attribute for source-specific value.

radius.caption: Radius
radius.description: Farthest horizontal distance from the reported location at which any UA in a group may be located (meters). Also allows defining the area where an Intent-Based Network Participant operation is taking place. Default: 0 m.

ram_size.caption: RAM Size
ram_size.description: The total amount of installed RAM, in Megabytes. For example: 2048.

rate_limit.caption: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: The rate limit for a rate-based rule.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

raw_data_hash.caption: Raw Data Hash
raw_data_hash.description: The hash, which describes the content of the raw_data field.

raw_data_size.caption: Raw Data Size
raw_data_size.description: The size of the raw data which was transformed into an OCSF event, in bytes.

rcode.caption: Response Code
rcode.description: The server response code, normalized to the caption of the rcode_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

rcode_id.caption: Response Code ID
rcode_id.description: The normalized identifier of the server response code. See specific usage.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The DNS response code is unknown.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The DNS response code is not defined by the RFC. See the rcode attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

rdata.caption: DNS RData
rdata.description: The data describing the DNS resource. The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.

record_index_in_array.caption: Record Index in Array
record_index_in_array.description: The index of the record in the array of records.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs supporting the finding/detection.

referrer.caption: HTTP Referrer
referrer.description: The request header that identifies the address of the previous web page, which is linked to the current web page or resource being requested.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The name or the code of a region. See specific usage.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Describes analytics related to the analytic of a finding or detection as identified by the security product.

related_component.caption: Related Component
related_component.description: The package URL (PURL) of the component that this software component has a relationship with.

related_cves.caption: Related CVEs
related_cves.description: Describes Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) entries that are related to an entity. See specific usage.

related_cwes.caption: Related CWEs
related_cwes.description: Describes Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) entries that are related to an entity. See specific usage.

related_events.caption: Related Events/Findings
related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product. Note that these events may or may not be in OCSF.

related_events_count.caption: Related Events/Findings Count
related_events_count.description: Number of related events or findings.

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerability IDs
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerability IDs (e.g. CVE ID) that are related to this vulnerability.

relation.caption: Relation
relation.description: The relationship between two entities. See specific usage.

relationship.caption: Relationship
relationship.description: The relationship between two software components, normalized to the caption of the relationship_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

relationship_id.caption: Relationship ID
relationship_id.description: The normalized identifier of the relationship between two software components.

1.caption: Depends On
1.description: The component is a dependency of another component. Can be used to define both direct and transitive dependencies.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The relationship is not mapped. See the relationship attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

relay.caption: Relay
relay.description: The network relay that is associated with the event.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

remote_display.caption: Remote Display
remote_display.description: The remote display affiliated with the event

reply_to.caption: Reply To
reply_to.description: The machine-readable email header Reply-To value, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

reply_to_list.caption: Reply To List
reply_to_list.description: The machine-readable email header Reply-To values, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

reply_to_mailboxes.caption: Reply To Mailboxes
reply_to_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header Reply To Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

reporter.caption: Reporter
reporter.description: The entity from which an event or finding was first reported. See specific usage.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Contains the original and normalized reputation scores.

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: General Purpose API Request Object. See specific usage

requested_permissions.caption: Requested Permissions
requested_permissions.description: The permissions mask. See specific usage.

requirements.caption: Compliance Requirements
requirements.description: A list of requirements associated to a specific control in an industry or regulatory framework. e.g. NIST.800-53.r5 AU-10

resource_relationship.caption: Resource Relationship
resource_relationship.description: Describes entities related to the resource, using a graph structure. See specific usage.

resource_type.caption: Resource Type
resource_type.description: The resource type as defined by the event source.

resources.caption: Resources Array
resources.description: Describes details about resources that were affected by the activity/event.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: General Purpose API Response Object. See specific usage.

response_time.caption: Response Time
response_time.description: The Domain Name System (DNS) response time.

return_path.caption: Return Path
return_path.description: The address found in the 'Return-Path' header, which indicates where bounce messages (non-delivery reports) should be sent. This address is often set by the sending system and may differ from the 'From' or 'Sender' addresses. For example, mailer-daemon@senderserver.com.

return_value.caption: Return Value
return_value.description: The value returned from a function.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

role.caption: Role
role.description: The role of an entity in the context of the event or finding, normalized to the caption of the role_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

role_id.caption: Role ID
role_id.description: The normalized identifier of an entity's role in the context of the event or finding. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The role is not mapped. See the role attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

row_number.caption: Row Number
row_number.description: The row number. See specific usage.

rpc_interface.caption: Remote Procedure Call Interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface object describes the details pertaining to the remote procedure call interface.

rssi.caption: RSSI
rssi.description: Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI) is a measurement of the power of a radio signal. See specific usage.

rule.caption: Rule
rule.description: The rules that reported the events.

run_mode_ids.caption: Run Mode IDs
run_mode_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers that describe application attributes when it is running. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The run mode is not mapped. See the run_modes attribute, which contains data source specific values.

run_modes.caption: Run Modes
run_modes.description: The list of run_modes, normalized to the captions of the run_mode_ids values.  In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source. See specific usage.

run_state.caption: Run State
run_state.description: The state of the job or service, normalized to the caption of the run_state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

run_state_id.caption: Run State ID
run_state_id.description: The normalized identifier of the state of the job or service. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The run state is not mapped. See the run_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

runtime.caption: Runtime
runtime.description: The backend running the container, such as containerd or cri-o.

samesite.caption: SameSite
samesite.description: The cookie attribute that lets servers specify whether/when cookies are sent with cross-site requests. Values are: Strict, Lax or None

sandbox.caption: Sandbox
sandbox.description: The name of the containment jail (i.e., sandbox). For example, hardened_ps, high_security_ps, oracle_ps, netsvcs_ps, or default_ps.

sans.caption: Subject Alternative Names
sans.description: The list of subject alternative names that are secured by a specific certificate.

sbom.caption: Software Bill Of Materials
sbom.description: The Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) object describes the characteristics of a generated SBOM for a software package.

scale_factor.caption: Scale Factor
scale_factor.description: The numeric scale factor of display.

scan.caption: Scan
scan.description: The Scan object describes characteristics of a scan.  See specific usage.

schedule_uid.caption: Schedule UID
schedule_uid.description: The unique identifier of the schedule associated with a scan job.

scheme.caption: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: http, https, ftp, or sftp.

scim.caption: SCIM
scim.description: The System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) resource object provides a structured set of attributes related to SCIM protocols used for identity provisioning and management across cloud-based platforms. It standardizes user and group provisioning details, enabling identity synchronization and lifecycle management with compatible Identity Providers (IdPs) and applications. SCIM is defined in RFC-7634

references.description: System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) RFC.

scim_group_schema.caption: SCIM Group Schema
scim_group_schema.description: SCIM provides a schema for representing groups, identified using the following schema URI: urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:Group as defined in RFC-7634. This attribute will capture key-value pairs for the scheme implemented in a SCIM resource.

references.description: System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) RFC spec.

scim_user_schema.caption: SCIM User Schema
scim_user_schema.description: SCIM provides a resource type for user resources. The core schema for user is identified using the following schema URI: urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User as defined in RFC-7634. his attribute will capture key-value pairs for the scheme implemented in a SCIM resource. This object is inclusive of both the basic and Enterprise User Schema Extension.

references.description: System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) RFC spec.

scopes.caption: Scopes
scopes.description: Scopes define the specific permissions or actions that the client is allowed to perform on behalf of the user. Each scope represents a different set of permissions, and the user can selectively grant or deny access to specific scopes during the authorization process.

score.caption: Reputation Score
score.description: The reputation score, normalized to the caption of the score_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

1.caption: Very Safe
1.description: Long history of good behavior.

2.caption: Safe
2.description: Consistently good behavior.

3.caption: Probably Safe
3.description: Reasonable history of good behavior.

4.caption: Leans Safe
4.description: Starting to establish a history of normal behavior.

5.caption: May not be Safe
5.description: No established history of normal behavior.

6.caption: Exercise Caution
6.description: Starting to establish a history of suspicious or risky behavior.

7.caption: Suspicious/Risky
7.description: A site with a history of suspicious or risky behavior. (spam, scam, potentially unwanted software, potentially malicious).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The reputation score is not mapped. See the rep_score attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

script_content.caption: Script Content
script_content.description: The script content, normalized to UTF-8 encoding irrespective of its original encoding. When emitting this attribute, it may be appropriate to truncate large scripts. When consuming this attribute, large scripts should be anticipated.

section_a.caption: JA4 Section A
section_a.description: The 'a' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_b.caption: JA4 Section B
section_b.description: The 'b' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_c.caption: JA4 Section C
section_c.description: The 'c' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_d.caption: JA4 Section D
section_d.description: The 'd' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

secure.caption: Secure
secure.description: The cookie attribute to only send cookies to the server with an encrypted request over the HTTPS protocol.

security_level.caption: Security Level
security_level.description: The current security level of the entity

security_level_id.caption: Security Level ID
security_level_id.description: The current security level of the entity

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security level is not mapped. See the security_level attribute, which contains data source specific values.

security_questions.caption: Security Questions
security_questions.description: The question(s) provided to user for a question-based authentication factor.

security_states.caption: Security States
security_states.description: The current security states. See specific usage.

sender.caption: Sender
sender.description: The machine readable email address of the system or server that actually transmitted the email message, extracted from the email headers per RFC 5322. This differs from the from field, which shows the message author. The sender field is most commonly used when multiple addresses appear in the from_list field, or when the transmitting system is different from the message author (such as when sending on behalf of someone else).

sender_mailbox.caption: Sender Mailbox
sender_mailbox.description: The human readable email address of the system or server that actually transmitted the email message, extracted from the email headers per RFC 5322. This differs from the from_mailbox field, which shows the message author. The sender mailbox field is most commonly used when multiple addresses appear in the from_mailboxes field, or when the transmitting system is different from the message author (such as when sending on behalf of someone else).

sensitivity.caption: Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the firewall rule in the matched event. For example: HIGH.

sequence.caption: Sequence Number
sequence.description: Sequence number of the event. The sequence number is a value available in some events, to make the exact ordering of events unambiguous, regardless of the event time precision.

serial_number.caption: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

server_ciphers.caption: Server Cipher Suites
server_ciphers.description: The server cipher suites that were exchanged during the TLS handshake negotiation.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The service that pertains to the event.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The authenticated user or service session.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

share.caption: Share
share.description: The share name. See specific usage.

share_type.caption: Share Type
share_type.description: The share type, normalized to the caption of the share_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

share_type_id.caption: Share Type ID
share_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the share type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The share type is not mapped. See the share_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

short_desc.caption: Short Description
short_desc.description: The short description that pertains to the object or event. See specific usage.

signature.caption: Digital Signature
signature.description: The digital signature of the file.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

smtp_from.caption: SMTP From
smtp_from.description: The value of the SMTP MAIL FROM command.

smtp_hello.caption: SMTP Hello
smtp_hello.description: The value of the SMTP HELO or EHLO command.

smtp_to.caption: SMTP To
smtp_to.description: The value of the SMTP envelope RCPT TO command.

sni.caption: Server Name Indication
sni.description: The Server Name Indication (SNI) extension sent by the client.

software_components.caption: Software Components
software_components.description: The list of software components used in the software package.

source.caption: Source
source.description: The source of the event or object. See specific usage.

sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

span.caption: Span
span.description: The information about the span. See specific usage.

speed.caption: Speed
speed.description: Ground speed of flight. This value is provided in meters per second with a minimum resolution of 0.25 m/s. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 255 m/s.

speed_accuracy.caption: Speed Accuracy
speed_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal ground speed. Measured in meters/second.

spf.caption: SPF Status
spf.description: The Sender Policy Framework (SPF) status of the email.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing towards the source of an entity. See specific usage.

sso.caption: SSO
sso.description: The Single Sign-On (SSO) object provides a structure for normalizing SSO attributes, configuration, and/or settings from Identity Providers.

standards.caption: Compliance Standards: List
standards.description: Compliance standards are a set of criteria organizations can follow to protect sensitive and confidential information. e.g. NIST SP 800-53, CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0, ISO/IEC 27001

start_address.caption: Start Address
start_address.description: The start address of the execution.

start_column.caption: Start Column
start_column.description: The start column number. See specific usage.

start_line.caption: Start Line
start_line.description: The line number of the first line of code block identified as vulnerable.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period. See specific usage.

start_type.caption: Start Type
start_type.description: The start type of a service, driver, or application.

start_type_id.caption: Start Type ID
start_type_id.description: The start type ID of a service or application.

1.caption: Auto
1.description: Service started automatically during system startup.

2.caption: Boot
2.description: Device driver started by the system loader.

3.caption: On Demand
3.description: Started on demand. For example, by the Windows Service Control Manager when a process calls the StartService function.

4.caption: Disabled
4.description: The service is disabled, and cannot be started.

8.caption: System Changed
8.description: Started when a system item, such as a file or registry key, changes.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The start type is not mapped. See the start_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

startup_item.caption: Startup Item
startup_item.description: The startup item object describes an application component that has associated startup criteria and configurations.

state.caption: State
state.description: The state of the event or object, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

state_id.caption: State ID
state_id.description: The normalized state ID of the event or object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_details.caption: Status Details
status_details.description: A list of descriptions, containing additional information about the event/finding status.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

storage_class.caption: Storage Class
storage_class.description: The storage class of the entity. See specific usage.

stratum.caption: Stratum
stratum.description: The stratum level of the NTP server's time source, normalized to the caption of the stratum_id value.

stratum_id.caption: Stratum ID
stratum_id.description: The normalized identifier of the stratum level, as defined in RFC-5905.

1.caption: Primary Server
1.description: The highest precision primary server (e.g atomic clock or GPS).

2.caption: Secondary Server
2.description: A secondary level server (possible values: 2-15).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The stratum level is not mapped. See the stratum attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

sub_technique.caption: MITRE Sub-technique
sub_technique.description: The Sub-technique object describes the MITRE ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Sub-technique ID and/or name associated to an attack.

subdomain.caption: Subdomain
subdomain.description: The subdomain portion of the URL. For example: sub in https://sub.example.com or sub2.sub1 in https://sub2.sub1.example.com.

subdomains.caption: Subdomains
subdomains.description: An array of subdomain strings. Can be used to collect several subdomains such as those from Domain Generation Algorithms (DGAs).

subgroup.caption: Subgroup
subgroup.description: A subgroup that was added to or removed from the group.

subject.caption: Subject Details
subject.description: The identifier of the subject. See specific usage.

subnet_prefix.caption: Subnet Prefix Length
subnet_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length determines the number of bits used to represent the network part of the IP address. The remaining bits are reserved for identifying individual hosts within that subnet.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

supporting_data.caption: Supporting Data
supporting_data.description: Additional data supporting a finding as provided by security tool

surname.caption: Surname
surname.description: The last or family name for the user.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

system_call.caption: System Call
system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.

table.caption: Table
table.description: The table object represents a table within a structured relational database or datastore, which contains columns and rows of data that are able to be create, updated, deleted and queried.

tactic.caption: MITRE Tactic
tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the MITRE ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack.

tactics.caption: Tactics
tactics.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or tactic name that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK® Matrix.

@deprecated.message: Use the labels or tags attribute instead.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs attached to an entity. A Tag may be used to categorize, filter, and search for entities. For e.g. "Environment": "Production", "Owner": "007". See specific usage.

target.caption: Target
target.description: The target of the event or object. See specific usage.

tcp_flags.caption: TCP Flags
tcp_flags.description: The network connection TCP header flags (i.e., control bits).

tcp_state_id.caption: TCP State ID
tcp_state_id.description: The state of the TCP socket for the network connection.

1.caption: ESTABLISHED
1.description: The socket has an established connection between a local application and a remote peer.

2.caption: SYN-SENT
2.description: The socket is actively trying to establish a connection to a remote peer.

3.caption: SYN-RECEIVED
3.description: The socket has passively received a connection request from a remote peer.

4.caption: FIN-WAIT-1
4.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has not yet acknowledged the close, and the system is waiting for it to close its half of the connection.

5.caption: FIN-WAIT-2
5.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has acknowledged the close, and the system is waiting for it to close its half of the connection.

6.caption: TIME-WAIT
6.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application, the remote peer has closed its half of the connection, and the system is waiting to be sure that the remote peer received the last acknowledgement.

7.caption: CLOSED
7.description: The socket is not in use.

8.caption: CLOSE-WAIT
8.description: The socket connection has been closed by the remote peer, and the system is waiting for the local application to close its half of the connection.

9.caption: LAST-ACK
9.description: The socket connection has been closed by the remote peer, the local application has closed its half of the connection, and the system is waiting for the remote peer to acknowledge the close.

10.caption: LISTEN
10.description: The socket is listening for incoming connections.

11.caption: CLOSING
11.description: The socket connection has been closed by the local application and the remote peer simultaneously, and the remote peer has not yet acknowledged the close attempt of the local application.

technique.caption: MITRE Technique
technique.description: The Technique object describes the MITRE ATT&CK® or ATLAS™ Technique ID and/or name associated to an attack.

terminal.caption: Terminal
terminal.description: The Pseudo Terminal. Ex: the tty or pts value.

terminated_time.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time.description: The time when the entity was terminated. See specific usage.

threat_actor.caption: Threat Actor
threat_actor.description: A threat actor is an individual or group that conducts malicious cyber activities, often with financial, political, or ideological motives.

ticket.caption: Ticket
ticket.description: The linked ticket in the ticketing system.

tickets.caption: Tickets
tickets.description: The associated ticket(s) in the ticketing system. Each ticket contains details like ticket ID, status, etc.

tid.caption: Thread ID
tid.description: The identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.

@deprecated.message: tid is deprecated in favor of ptid. ptid has type long_t which can accommodate the thread identifiers returned by all platforms (e.g. 64-bit on MacOS).

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timespan.caption: Time Span
timespan.description:
The Time Span object represents different time period durations. If a timespan is fractional, i.e. crosses one period, e.g. a week and 3 days, more than one may be populated since each member is of integral type. In that case type_id if present should be set to Other.

A timespan may also be defined by its time interval boundaries, start_time and end_time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

title.caption: Title
title.description: The title of an entity. See specific usage.

tlp.caption: Traffic Light Protocol
tlp.description: The Traffic Light Protocol was created to facilitate greater sharing of potentially sensitive information and more effective collaboration. TLP provides a simple and intuitive schema for indicating with whom potentially sensitive information can be shared.

to.caption: To
to.description: The machine-readable email header To values, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

to_mailboxes.caption: To Mailboxes
to_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header To Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

total.caption: Total
total.description: The total number of items. See specific usage.

trace.caption: Trace
trace.description: The information about the trace. See specific usage.

track_direction.caption: Track Direction
track_direction.description: Direction of flight expressed as a “True North-based” ground track angle. This value is provided in clockwise degrees with a minimum resolution of 1 degree. If aircraft is not moving horizontally, use the “Unknown” value

traffic.caption: Traffic
traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point of time. Intended to be used alongside Network Connection.

traits.caption: Traits
traits.description: The traits that describe characteristics, features of an entity. See specific usage.

transaction_uid.caption: Transaction UID
transaction_uid.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

transformation_info_list.caption: Transformation Info
transformation_info_list.description: An array of transformation info that describes the mappings or transforms applied to the data.

transmit_time.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time.description: The event transmission time from one device to another.  See specific usage.

tree_uid.caption: Tree UID
tree_uid.description: The tree id is a unique SMB identifier which represents an open connection to a share.

ttl.caption: TTL
ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.

tunnel_interface.caption: Interface
tunnel_interface.description: The information about the tunnel interface. See specific usage.

tunnel_type.caption: Type
tunnel_type.description: The tunnel type. See specific usage.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of an object or value, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of an object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

types.caption: Types
types.description: The type/s of an entity. See specific usage.

udid.caption: Unique Device Identifier
udid.description: The Apple assigned Unique Device Identifier (UDID). For iOS, iPadOS, tvOS, watchOS and visionOS devices, this is the UDID. For macOS devices, it is the Provisioning UDID. For example: 00008020-008D4548007B4F26

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier. See specific usage.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier. See specific usage.

unique_malware_count.caption: Unique Malware Count
unique_malware_count.description: The number of unique malware detected during a scan. See specific usage.

unmanned_aerial_system.caption: Unmanned Aerial System
unmanned_aerial_system.description: The Unmanned Aerial System object describes the characteristics, Position Location Information (PLI), and other metadata of Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) and other unmanned and drone systems used in Remote ID. Remote ID is defined in the Standard Specification for Remote ID and Tracking (ASTM Designation: F3411-22a) ASTM F3411-22a.

unmanned_system_operating_area.caption: UAS Operating Area
unmanned_system_operating_area.description: The UAS Operating Area object describes details about a precise area of operations for a UAS flight or mission.

unmanned_system_operator.caption: Unmanned Systems Operator
unmanned_system_operator.description: The human or machine operator of an Unmanned System.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

untruncated_size.caption: Untruncated Size
untruncated_size.description: The size in bytes of an attribute before truncation. See specific usage.

unused_privileges_count.caption: Unused Privileges Count
unused_privileges_count.description: The number of unused Privileges. See specific usage.

unused_services_count.caption: Unused Services Count
unused_services_count.description: The number of unused services. See specific usage.

uploaded_time.caption: Uploaded Time
uploaded_time.description: The timestamp at which an entity was uploaded. See specific usage.

uri.caption: URI
uri.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) is a string of characters that identifies a resource on the Internet. URIs can identify physical resources, like webpages and documents. See specific usage.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL string. See RFC 1738. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

urls.caption: URLs
urls.description: The URLs that pertain to the event or object.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that pertains to the event or object.

user_agent.caption: HTTP User-Agent
user_agent.description: The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

user_result.caption: User Result
user_result.description: The result of the user account change. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes.

users.caption: Users
users.description: The users that pertain to the event or object.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier. See specific usage.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value associated to an attribute. See specific usage.

values.caption: Values
values.description: An array of values associated to an attribute. See specific usage.

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

vendor_attributes.caption: Vendor Attributes
vendor_attributes.description:
The Vendor Attributes object can be used to represent values of attributes populated by the Vendor/Finding Provider. It can help distinguish between the vendor-provided values and consumer-updated values, of key attributes like severity_id.
The original finding producer should not populate this object. It should be populated by consuming systems that support data mutability.

vendor_id_list.caption: Vendor ID List
vendor_id_list.description: The list of vendor IDs. See specific usage.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor. See specific usage.

verdict.caption: Verdict
verdict.description: The verdict assigned to an Incident finding.

verdict_id.caption: Verdict ID
verdict_id.description: The normalized verdict of an Incident.

1.caption: False Positive
1.description: The incident is a false positive.

2.caption: True Positive
2.description: The incident is a true positive.

3.caption: Disregard
3.description: The incident can be disregarded as it is unimportant, an error or accident.

7.caption: Insufficient Data
7.description: The incident has insufficient data to make a verdict.

8.caption: Security Risk
8.description: The incident is a security risk.

9.caption: Managed Externally
9.description: The incident remediation or required actions are managed externally.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

vertical_speed.caption: Vertical Speed
vertical_speed.description: Vertical speed upward relative to the WGS-84 datum, measured in meters per second. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 63 m/s.

volume.caption: Volume
volume.description: The volume on the storage device where the file is located. See specific usage.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

vulnerabilities.caption: Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.description: This object describes vulnerabilities reported in a security finding.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability object describes details related to the observed vulnerability

web_resources.caption: Web Resources
web_resources.description: Describes details about web resources that were affected by an activity/event.

web_resources_result.caption: Web Resources Result
web_resources_result.description: The results of the activity on web resources. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes of the web resources.

whois.caption: WHOIS
whois.description: The resources of a WHOIS record for a given domain. This can include domain names, IP address blocks, autonomous system information, and/or contact and registration information for a domain.

working_directory.caption: Working Directory
working_directory.description: The working directory of a process.

x_forwarded_for.caption: X-Forwarded-For
x_forwarded_for.description: The X-Forwarded-For header identifying the originating IP address(es) of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy or a load balancer.

x_originating_ip.caption: X-Originating-IP
x_originating_ip.description: The X-Originating-IP header identifying the emails originating IP address(es).

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description:
An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

For example: Windows alternate data stream attributes (ADS stream name, ADS size, etc.), user-defined or application-defined attributes, ACL, owner, primary group, etc. Examples from DCS:

  • ads_name
  • ads_size
  • dacl
  • owner
  • primary_group
  • link_name - name of the link associated to the file.
  • hard_link_count - the number of links that are associated to the file.

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment. See specific usage.

ai_model.caption: AI Model
ai_model.description: The AI Model object describes the characteristics of an AI/ML model. Examples include language models like GPT-4, embedding models like text-embedding-ada-002, and computer vision models like CLIP.

message_context.caption: Message Context
message_context.description: Communication context for AI system interactions including protocols, roles, clients, and session information for MCP and other AI communication systems.

ai_provider.caption: AI Provider
ai_provider.description: AI service provider or organization name.

embedding_model.caption: Embedding Model
embedding_model.description: Model used for creating embeddings in AI retrieval systems.

prompt_tokens.caption: Prompt Tokens
prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the input prompt for this message.

completion_tokens.caption: Completion Tokens
completion_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the model's response/completion for this message.

total_tokens.caption: Total Tokens
total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used for this message (prompt + completion).

ai_role_id.caption: AI Role ID
ai_role_id.description: The originator or target role of the message.

types.caption: Data Types
types.description: The data types available in OCSF. Each data type specifies constraints in the form regular expressions, max lengths or value limits. Implementers of OCSF should ensure they abide to these constraints.

bytestring_t.caption: Byte String
bytestring_t.description: Base 64 encoded immutable byte sequence. Traditional Base 64 is preferred but publishers may use URL-safe Base 64 when known to be acceptable to consumers. These encodings are described in RFC 4648.

datetime_t.caption: Datetime
datetime_t.description:
The Internet Date/Time format as defined in RFC-3339. For example:
2024-09-10T23:20:50.520Z,
2024-09-10 23:20:50.520789Z.

file_hash_t.caption: Hash
file_hash_t.description:
Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example:
MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

file_path_t.caption: File Path
file_path_t.description:
The full path to the file. For example: For example:
c:\windows\system32\svchost.exe.

hostname_t.caption: Hostname
hostname_t.description:
Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. It may be a fully qualified domain name (FQDN). For example:
r2-d2.example.com.,
mx.example.com

ip_t.caption: IP Address
ip_t.description:
Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example:
192.168.200.24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

json_t.caption: JSON
json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.

resource_uid_t.caption: Resource UID
resource_uid_t.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

subnet_t.caption: Subnet
subnet_t.description:
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet. For example:
192.168.1.0/24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

timestamp_t.caption: Timestamp
timestamp_t.description:
The timestamp format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example:
1618524549901.
